snippet: Over the last three years, the city has been resurveying its parks, relying on satellites instead of 19th century cartographers. There were both winners and losers.
abstract: Parks and Recreation Dept's three-year effort to resurvey parks in New York City has yielded number of changes to official park measurements, including three hundred and fifty eight-acre reduction in official size of Flushing Meadows-Corona Park; change could have serious implications for debate over whether part of park should be dedicated to proposed soccer stadium.
lead_paragraph: Over the last three years, the city has been resurveying its parks, relying on satellites instead of 19th century cartographers. There were both winners and losers.

headline.seo: Surveying Effort Alters Sizes of Some New York Parks
headline.main: How Big Is That Park? City Now Has the Answer
headline.print_headline: How Big Is That Park? City Now Has the Answer
